data.description:
“An adorable mini-golf game that is unexpectedly convincing” — New York Times

“Brilliantly designed... Seriously, you have no idea how good VR mini-golf is” — CNET

“Everyone with an Oculus Quest 2 needs to play Walkabout Mini Golf” — TechRadar

8 unique 18-hole courses to master (plus additional DLC courses available). 
Unlock Hard Mode for more challenging versions of all courses.
Guest Pass: allows guests of the player with a paid DLC course to play with their host for free.
Play solo, 1v1 online quick match, or create a private room with up to 8 players.
Extremely accurate physics that feels just like the real thing.
Collect over 144 custom balls hidden throughout (plus more in additional DLC courses).
Solve treasure hunts on each Hard Mode to earn special putters.
Supports cross-play and 90hz on Quest 2, 3, and Pro. 
Teleport and Smooth locomotion supported, as well as the ability to fly.
Supports Meta Quest groups, invites and friend lists.
UPDATED with Tourist Trap remaster, driving range, practice green, and more!
New avatars featuring lip sync, a quadrillion+ combinations.
Supports English, French, Spanish, German, Japanese, Korean and Chinese.

NOTE: New DLC add-on courses are not available to Quest 1 players after June 2023 (Journey to the Center of the Earth), nor is the ability to access multiplayer features with other headsets other than players with Quest 1. More info at www.mightycoconut.com/quest1

changelog.change_log:
Venice Release
-Run of business: E/H courses, avatars, etc.

Accessibility Settings
-Introduced a handful of features to assist players, including a magnifier, large wrist UI, and smoothed controller motion.

Clam Avatar Colors Added
-Previously only had Purple

Previous Course Bug Fixes
-PSVR2 Atlantis: Fix game crashing when returning to Welcome Island from both Easy and Hard for some users.
-IL: Fix for Record showing as "?0" in Welcome Island
-ILH8: Fix for ball being considered in-play when falling into grates. Now is considered as falling out of bounds and ball returns to previous position.
-ILE18: Fix for Ball being able to slide off final Ramp after making it into the hole.
-MYE/H11: Fix for the bug where the sky stays dark when you come up from Hole 11, the workaround of going into the scorecard and back no longer works. The sky is staying dark.
-JCH: Fix for Headlamp Setting not always initializing Properly (i.e. If previously enabled sometimes setting would show enabled on loading into Journey Hard but the light would still be coming from your putter instead of your head).

Quest: Fix for DLCs not being available when disconnected from WiFi after Meta v62 SDK Update

New Course Details:
36 Holes | 18 easy, 18 hard
Wintry Avatar cosmetics update
Unique in-course mechanics, such as ice rays and hot plates

Walkabout Updates:
-Forfeit Hole Button
Feel like giving up? Now we let you! Find a new Forfeit Hole button on your scorecard's settings tab

-New hole celebration: Condor
Prepare to flex on your fellow golfers with a new hole celebration animation

-New Auto Teleport Feature
This feature is especially handy for our grip-to-putter players, but is a native setting designed for all players

-25th Course Anniversary Hat & Crown
These will be available for a limited time. Snag yours while you can!

-Custom Avatars on Top
Originally all of the Custom Avatars were preceded by course-specific faces, we have now swapped that around.

-Gray hair, we care!
Our senior golfers can now show off their gray locs in style! We have retired our dark blue hair option for the popularly requested gray hair color. Light blue hair is still available

-MW H18 Fix
We've added another fix to MWH18 and anticipate that this will resolve some remaining bugged behavior

-Quest 3: Tethys Meteors Fix
The meteors on Tethys should now be spinning as-intended for Q3 devices

Today's update includes several enhancements for players on all platforms including the availability of Laser Lairs with custom avatars, two putters, and two foxhunts (including a bonus Exploding Kittens foxhunt from Elan Lee), a game-wide foxhunt reset button in the settings menu, a beach ball, and performance improvements. Please note that this build is not backward compatible and unavailable to Quest 1 players.

Randomized release now gives a pop up of which random course was selected with an option to exit and reselect a random course again

New avatar items: 2 heads, 2 hats, 2 beards, 1 pair of glasses, 1 piercing
This update addresses the recent issues for the menu, scorecard, updated random course functionality and Welcome Island plus more performances fixes and a couple of surprises

The update to Walkabout Mini Golf coinciding with the new course Upside Town includes adding a new more immersive preview mode for all courses, bug fixes related to "Quit to Main Menu", lighting issues in a few pre-existing courses, and overall performance tweaks.

The Atlantis update represents a major upgrade under the hood, resulting in performance improvements and some of the new features you'll see in Atlantis. Here's the most impactful changes:
-This release will require a recent version of the Meta OS. If you have automatic updates turned off, you'll need to turn those back on in your device settings.
-Multiplayer will not be backwards compatible, so all players in a private room will need to upgrade to the latest Atlantis version.
-Resolution Upgrade: Quest 2 players will see a 33% improvement in clarity! If you are manually adjusting the resolution through Sidequest, you'll want to revert that override.
-In practice mode, players will automatically advance to the next hole rather than going to the scorecard overview.
